definitions: having been taught a particular skill or type of behavior through practice and instruction over a period of time

examples.text: the first officer was also a trained pilot
trained volunteers provide a sympathetic ear and friendly advice
the riding school was founded in the 16th century to provide trained horses for the Imperial Army

shortDefinitions: having been taught particular skill or type of behaviour

definitions: (of a mental or physical faculty) having been developed and improved through instruction or practice

examples.text: the trained eye of a professional photographer
it takes a trained ear to detect the bird's high-pitched chirp

shortDefinitions: (of faculty) developed and improved through instruction or practice
